intro: Ecclinusa balata, commonly known as the balata tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The tree is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that develop into smooth, yellowish fruits. The latex sap of the balata tree is notable for its use in rubber production. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
